content: DBS Multiplier Savings DBS Bank Account General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 19 Sep 2018Is it possible to cancel my POSB regular savings plan and re-sign up to qualify for extra interest under the 'Investments with DBS/POSB' category for the Multiplier account?Hi guys! My POSB regular savings plan has been ongoing for more than 12 months and I'm going to create a DBS multiplier account (I'm starting work soon).1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 19 Sep 2018Yes it is, but you'd have to cancel the plan, sell all your holdings, and wait for 6 months before you can qualify for the extra interest! (if i remember correctly, but i'm pretty sure i did)0 comments0
